name: AIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ2 SD-Updater対応版
description:
robo8080さん作成AI-StackChan2に次の修正を行いました。
・ rootCACertificate.h更新(2024-07-10)
・ ChatGPTのモデル変更：gpt-4o-mini
・ SD-Updater対応
・ サーボPortを外部ファイル（servo.txt）で設定。

SD-Updaterに対応した AiStackChan2 です。
ブート時に、SD_Updater用の画面が立ち上がります。
SDに入れた他のソフトを切り替えることができるようになります。

servo.txtファイルでサーボPortを設定します。
PortAとPortC両方対応。次のリンクを参照。
https://github.com/NoRi-230401/SDU-AI_StackChan2

本体は次の２つに対応
・M5Stack Core2 for AWS
・M5Stack Core2 v1.0
M5Stack Core2 v1.1 には、対応していません。

name: ATOM Blynk万能固件
description: 该固件可快速体验Blynk同时通过串口通讯让任意单片机接入Blynk，利用固件板载功能也可直接使用Blynk控制ATOM管脚电平状态与获取管脚电平变化，可轻松将传感器转化为物联网远程传感器或执行器，让物联网的使用变得更加简单，首次使用按住板载按钮不松开，单击复位按钮，指示灯出现红蓝交替闪烁时松开，设备自动开启热点ATOM_Blynk_XXXXXXXXX，密码XXXXXXXX，连接此热点访问IP地址192.168.4.1访问配置服务器与网络信息，确认无误后重启设备开始使用，设备与Blynk服务器断开连接，指示灯以100毫秒为周期持续闪烁，硬件串口与软串口波特率均为9600，其中软串口RX（26）TX（32），串口通过["PIN","value"]的json格式数据交互虚拟引脚数据，例如["V6","1"]表示虚拟引脚V6发送或接收到数据1，V0-V7已被ATOM占用，其他用途请用其他虚拟引脚，示例服务器地址为国内免费Blynk服务器地址仅供测试，稳定使用请私有部署服务器。温馨提示：第一次使用连接电脑打开串口监视器波特率为9600，查看调试信息
author: peien

name: ATOM网络MP3播放器

通过订阅MQTT主题收到网络MP3链接播放MP3，同时单击板载按钮可以对设置的主题发送一个名为atom的消息，使用需要通过M5Burner配置以下信息：
ssid  WiFi名称
pass  WiFi密码
broker  MQTT服务器地址
username  MQTT用户名
password  MQTT用户密码
port  MQTT开放端口
client_id  MQTT客户端ID（必须唯一）
topic  网络MP3订阅主题
button  ATOM板载按钮发送主题

低成本物联网服务器搭建交流qq群713809079
author: peien

name: ATOM网络按钮（自定义MQTT服务器）
description:
通过订阅MQTT主题改变板载指示灯颜色，同时单击,双击,长按开始,长按中与长按结束向指定主题分别发送1,2,3,4,5，使用需要通过M5BurnerNVS检查并配置以下信息：
ssid  WiFi名称
pass  WiFi密码
broker  MQTT服务器地址（默认为公共EMQX服务器地址
broker.emqx.io）
username  MQTT用户名（默认为空）
password  MQTT用户密码（默认为空）
port  MQTT开放端口（默认为1883）
client_id  MQTT客户端ID（必须唯一，若为空将自动设置为设备MAC地址）
topic  ATOM订阅主题（若为空则为订阅主题为IN_(MAC)）
button  ATOM板载按钮发送主题（若为空则为发布主题为OUT_(MAC)）

注意：ATOM板载指示灯颜色为16进制GRB模式如0x00ff00红色，0x0000f0蓝色，0xff0000绿色，其他以此类比。当WiFi名称与密码其中一个为空时指示灯将依次按红蓝绿顺序间隔500毫秒闪烁10次提示配置网络。按住板载按钮不松开单击复位按钮板载指示灯间隔100毫秒红黑闪烁20次后任然按住将清除WiFi信息重新配网

该应用可以将ATOM结合Nodered与homeasstant等工具用于家庭自动话
低成本物联网服务器搭建交流qq群713809079
不定期分享教程博客点击Github图标直达

name: Bitcoin Card Wallet
description:
Bitcoin Card Wallet allows you to generate seeds, addresses, and sign transactions. The seed is never stored on the device itself, and to sign a transaction, you must enter the seed words or use an RFID tag to store it.

- Manage Wallets: create seeds, public key, mnemonic words, balance

- Transaction Signing: Sign Bitcoin transactions directly on the device using your seed or RFID tag.

- Seed Storage on RFID Tags: Store your seed securely on an RFID MIFARE 1K tag (optionnal).

- Encrypted Seed Backup: Encrypt and store your seed on RFID tags for enhanced protection.

- Seed Restoration: restore your seed from RFID tags,or by manually entering mnemonic words.

- Transaction File Handling: Sign and export PSBT transaction files directly on the device.

- QR Code: Generate and display QR codes for easy sharing of Bitcoin and balance addresses.

- USB Typing: Emulate a USB keyboard to type out Bitcoin addresses.

- SD Card: Support for SD card storage to save and retrieve wallet data and saving PSBT file.

- Passphrase: Generate and use seeds with an optional passphrase for enhanced security.

Enjoy!

name: Clone your remote
description:
The app is intended to work with any generic IR receiver module for the Arduino. You don't even need to have it wired with GROVE connector. You can just wire it yourself with the jumper wires according to the module pinout. Attach signal pin to G1 pin of the GROVE port. And you need the SD card to be inserted into the Cardputer so the app could store commands from your remote.
============================
Supported IR protocols
All that IRRemote library supports
============================
Current features
Read signals from your remote. (All of that you read is stored in the array for the later send and limited to 42 entries).
Send signals that were read before.
Copy your remote to the SD card folder
Load copied remote from the SD card
Check Cardputer battery status
Settings (currently empty)

name: CoreS3 AIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ (顔検出)
description:
CoreS3の内蔵カメラで顔検出するAIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝです。
（robo8080さんのAIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝをベースとしています。）

・顔検出すると「御用でしょうか？」と音声認識を起動します。
・LCD左上隅にカメラ画像が表示されます。画像部分をタッチすると表示ON/OFFできます。
・画面中央左側をタッチするとサイレントモードになります。サイレントモード中に顔を検出すると、顔を追いかけるようにサーボ制御します。
・その他の機能はrobo8080さんのAIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝと同じです。

【動作条件】
タカオさんのPWMサーボ版シェルで動作確認済みです。
サーボはPort.Cに接続してください。

AIｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝをベースにしているため、SDカードに次の情報を保存しておく必要があります。
・WIFIのSSIDとパスワード
・ChatGPTのAPIキー
・Google Cloud STTのAPIキー
・VoiceVoxのAPIキー
APIキーの取得方法など詳細はrobo8080さんのGithubを参照ください。
https://github.com/robo8080/AI_StackChan2_README/

音声合成にはVOICEVOX:ずんだもんを使用しています。

【お知らせ】
2024/7/10
ルート証明書を更新しました（「わかりません」しか言わなくなる問題の対策）

name: Drumputer  Antonio J. Lara
description:
Drumputer User Manual   https://youtu.be/KHAryvxbX6w
Drumputer is a drum machine and sequencer program for the M5Cardputer device. It allows you to create, edit, and play drum patterns with up to 4 instruments and 16 , 32 steps.
   Main Interface
- The grid shows 4 rows (instruments) and 16 or 32 columns (steps).
- Numbers on the left (1-4) represent instruments.
- Numbers on top represent steps (1-16 or 1-32).
- Filled squares indicate active steps for each instrument.
- The red cursor shows the current editing position.
- The green bar shows the current playing step.

Basic Controls
- Use ',' and '/' keys to move the cursor left and right.
- Press ENTER to toggle a step on/off.
- Use keys 1-4 to select an instrument.
- Press '0' to start/stop playback.
- Use the up or down keys to increase/decrease BPM.
- Press 'E' to toggle between 16 and 32-step mode.

## Special Playback Modes
- Press '5' for two-step roll mode (alternates between first two steps).
- Press '6' for reverse playback mode.

## File Management
- Press '9' to enter/exit the WAV file selection menu.
- In the WAV menu, use ',' and '/' to navigate, ENTER to select a file.
- Press '7' to enter/exit the sequence management menu.
- In the sequence menu:
  - Use 'S' to toggle between Save and Load modes.
  - Use 'D' to enter Delete mode.
  - Use ',' and '/' to navigate, ENTER to perform the selected action.

## Synchronization
- The device outputs a 2 PPQ (Pulses Per Quarter Note) sync signal on pin G2 y Gnd 
- This allows synchronization with other music equipment.
- The sync pulse is sent twice per beat, aligned with the sequencer's timing.
Tips
- In the WAV selection menu, you can preview sounds as you navigate.
- Saved sequences include BPM, step count, pattern, and sample assignments.
- The 32-step mode allows for more complex patterns.
- Use the roll and reverse modes for interesting rhythmic variations.
The wav files go in the root of the sd memory 
with any name but if you rename it this way 1.wav, 2.wav, 3.wav, 4.wav
 they will sound by default on each track without selecting anything

# Disclaimer

While the Drumputer has been successfully tested with equipment such as the Korg Pocket Operator and TD-3 without issues, the creator and developer of this software do not assume any responsibility for potential damages that may occur to your equipment when using this device.

The use of the Drumputer, including its synchronization features, is at the user's own risk. Users are advised to exercise caution and ensure compatibility with their specific equipment before connecting or using the Drumputer with other devices.

By using the Drumputer, you acknowledge that you understand and accept these terms, and agree to use the device responsibly and at your own discretion.
Drumputer was developed with the help of AI over the last month. While it has been successfully tested, it is still in development.
Known issue: Simultaneous playback of WAVs on a track may slow down the beat. Marketing and selling is not permitted

name: ESP32 Marauder for M5Stick C Plus (Screen works)
description:
The latest updated version of ESP32Maurauder with SD Card support and some much needed changes to the on-screen menu. More features work, but there are still a few things that aren't fully operational. I was able to get PCAPs stored to the SD Card for offline cracking, so that's a start.

You have to build your own SD Card adapter to plug into the M5Stick C Plus. To wire this up, you can get any generic Arduino/esp32 SPI MicroSD slot with 6 pins. 

StickCPlus Header - SPI SD Card Reader
             3v3   -   3v3
              GND   -   GND
               G0   -   CLK
          G36/G25   -   MISO
              G26   -   MOSI
                       
CS on the reader should be jumpered to GND

Known issues:
Recommend using external power. When the battery voltage drops, even a little, some brands of SD Cards stop working properly and could get corrupted.
No touch screen, so you can only use the "next" key (side button) and "select" key (M5 button on the front) to navigate

Hiding in plain sight, Wi-Fi honeypots are deceitful wireless networks masquerading as legitimate hotspots. They act like digital sirens, luring unsuspecting users with the promise of free internet access. But behind this facade lies a sinister reality: a trap designed to steal your data or infect your devices with malicious software. These honey traps, often deployed by hackers and cybercriminals, exploit the public's insatiable thirst for free Wi-Fi, turning our desire for connection into a vulnerability.

name: GPS Logger
description:
WORKS WITH ALL UART GPS MODULES (M5, Grove...)

It reads GPS data, displays it on the screen, and saves the data to an SD card. The device operates in two modes: NORMAL mode and SLEEP mode.

- NORMAL: Displays the GPS data on the screen every 3 seconds while saving the GPS data to the SD card every minute (can be turned off).

- SLEEP: Saves the GPS data to the SD card every minute before entering light sleep mode. The Cardputer's screen is turned off, and it appears to be OFF.

* USAGE *

- You will need a UART GPS module connected to the M5Cardputer and an inserted SD card. This has been tested with the M5 GPS module and the Grove GPS module

- Select NORMAL or SLEEP mode

- The GPS data will be saved in the file gps_data.csv at the root of the SD card.

* CONTROLS : 

For NORMAL mode
       - OK Toggles SD card on/off.
       - S Toggles screen on/off.
       - + and - Adjusts brightness.

name: Gameboy Enhanced Firmware
description:
Gameboy Emulator; complete with configurable controls, audio, display and performance options, savegames, save states, filesystem navigation and no .gb rom file size limits imposed by memory. Various other enhancements. Accurate palettes. Partial Super Gameboy Enhancement support, including borders. Extended 12 colour mode, along with all official/original GBC palettes. 44 Analogue Pocket 12 colour community palettes included with automatic mapping of titles to AP palettes partially implemented. Pokemon Silver/Gold,  Dragon Warrior I&II and Azure dreams are the only confirmed fully supported .gbc titles, backwards compatible with the original gameboy and run in that mode. Emulator will behave as if you placed a gameboy colour cartridge into an original gameboy in most instances. Feel free to try other backwards compatible gbc games, but no garuntees on compatiblity. All *.gb and *.gbc files are listed by the file explorer in the current directory.

Read the instructions at the bottom for controls. Forked from original gb_cardputer implementation. As of version 0.75 a launcher is no longer required, versions prior to that have no bootloader merged so if you are having issues try using m5launcher to install.

Save states can be used by pressing the minus/underscore key to load,  and backspace/del to save.

Hold Fn and press the left arrow to mute audio
Hold Fn and press the right arrow to jump to 50/100% volume
Hold Fn and press the up/down arrows to change volume in smaller adjustments. When muted games will run slightly faster, but the impact of audio rendering isn't that heavy.

24.07.2024:0.78
* Reduced overall volume; it still draws enough power to cause the backlight to flicker with the boost on full effect and volume maxed but it was flickering badly with the new amplification code.
* Added revision number to boot sequence
* Added configurable BASS BOOST to settings menu (0 -> +42db gain)
* Removed dynamically allocated memory component for cartridge ram, 32k is largest any compatible game requires anyways so this is now a fixed buffer preventing memory fragmentation allowing for...
* Added ability to quit the current game and return to the file selection menu; there may be a slight sound as the next game starts. This is just left over audio buffer info from the previous emulation.
< spent time this month porting the emulator to T-Display S3 Touch ;gamepad support working in that version, this was research to hopefully discover the incompatibility the cardputer seems to be having >
07.07.2024:
* Added bass boost function to audio engine
* Added SGB support for pocket bomberman
* Improved audio dynamic range; less clipping at high volume levels.
* Fix bug with startup audio being forced to Mute (part of BLE debugging code I forgot to remove)
06.07.2024:v0.77
* Added adventures of lolo, james bond 007, The Rescue of Princess Blobette Starring A Boy and His Blob, Game & Watch Gallery, Arcade Classics No2 Centipede and Millipede SGB & AP support
* Increased speed of entering large directories in some circumstances
* Increased file list limit to 1024 entries maximum, provided there is sufficient memory. Most files probably use less than half the max file name size, so 1024x128 directory entry listings are easily accommodated. File names may still be a full 256 bytes in length.
29.06.2024:v0.76
* Compatibiliyy mode settings now take effect immediately if changed mid-game; will display message if mode is locked on due to override requirement (ie: battlezone which requires it on for any functionality)
* Button mapped to controller B and del/back button will return to a parent directory (if not at root)
* Added CRT Television border available for all games
* Added Star Wars: Super Return of the Jedi SGB & Ap support w/Border
* Increased file/directory listing limit to 512 entries per directory
* No longer crashes when there are too many files, will list first 512 files and display warning.
* Added warning message when too many files/directories exist to list.
25.06.2024:v0.75
* Firmware now contains bootloader so it can be loaded without a launcher/direct from m5burner
* Added SGP & AP support for Mega Man I/II and Mystic Quest
* Added USB serial debug output to the entire function chain leading up to the main emulator loop. This should hopefully aid in helping debug games, and provide more comprehensive information for trouble shooting.
* Added CPU mode to settings menu (CPU MODE: FAST/COMPATIBLE), defaults to fast. Enabled automatically for titles known to need this: Battlezone so far, will add any reported titles. For now it takes effect only upon restart of the emulator (will take effect immediately in future update). This disables all speed hacks,and forces rendering of every line of every frame.
* BLE gamepad support only stable in file picker, causes restart during emulation so still disabled.
* Fixed Minor bug with auto SGB mode flag setup
24.06.2024:v0.74
* Added compatibility mode that skips all speed hacks (skipped frames and unrenderd lines)
* Added automatic compatibility mode override for titles that are identified to require this, as a result Battlezone is now compatible.
* Added SGB support for Battlezone
* Resolved BLE server and SD card conflict; this took about a week of research and debugging.
20.05.2024:v0.73
* BLE startup behaviour implemented, BLE sync from main menu implemented
* Gamepad buttons a,b,x,y and d-pad directional control integrated
19.05.2024:v0.72
* Implemented Default Palette selection, SGB manual/auto selection and SGB border options
* Added Default Palette, SGB palette manual/auto, SGB border manual/auto/gboy to options menu
* Added BLE connect manual/auto, BLE button swap on/off (swaps a+b button mapping), BLE deadzone small/med/large for left-stick deadzone configuration
* All new options are now saved in a new iteration of the config file, as usual, any previous config file will automatically migrate to the new version
* BLE connection settings will be saved/loaded regardless of BLE compilation support for consistent configuration file layout
18.05.2024:v0.71
* Added SGB profiles for Alleyway, Baseball, Dr. Mario, Game Boy Wars, Kaeru no Tame, Kirbys Dream Land, Mario and Yoshi,Qix,Tennis,X,Yakyuman,Yoshi
(note: not all of these are compatible, but it almost completes the built in SGB maps that were included in the SGB hardware; future core updates may improve compatibilty)
* Added AP profiles for Alleyway, Baseball, Dr. Mario
* Added bluetooth library to the emulator, this has a fairly substantial memory cost and will be disabled until ready for deployment; made inclusion of the BLE code optional when compiling.
* Added initial hooks for gamepad support.
12.06.2024:v0.70
* Added per-game savestates (1 state/game in .qsv file), backspace to save, minus/underscore button to load
* All borders are now drawn as RGB565 sprites; almost no impact for FPS display now
* Borders now have a cooldown before changing, allowing the emulator to run smoothly when cycling options
* Increased scroll speed in file selection menu
* Changed number of file/directories displayed at once from 3 to 5
* Added Dragon Warrior I & II SGB & AP support w/ Border
* Added SGB border support for Pokemon Silver/Gold, SGB/AP colours temporarily set to exisiting pallets until better is found
11.06.2024(pm):v0.68
* Control A and Control Start will now also navigate into directories
* Message Box constrast increased (darker background)
* First item in subdirectories is selected (if anything is present) instead of return to parent directory option
* Added Generic Fantasy Border (from a jp only SGB game) available to all games
* Final Fantasy Legend II SGB * AP support (same as FFL1)
* Added Metroid II SGB & AP support
* Added Golf SGB & AP support
* Added Solar Striker SGB & AP support
* Added Missle Command/Asteroids SGB and AP support w/ border
* Added Space Invaders SGB & SP support w/ Border
11.06.2024(am):v0.67
* Added ability to return to parent directory if it exists
* Added ability to launch ROMs from other directories
* Hides System Volume Information if in root directory; this is probably not what the user wants.
10.06.2024:v0.66.5
* Added memsub_malloc() and memsub_freeall() functions to allow paging memory to be used for other purposes:namely, file browsing.
* Changed file_picker() function to use memsub_malloc() / memsub_freeall(), limits are as follows:
256 files/folders per folder, maximum path+file length+3 letter extension is 256 bytes
There is no limit to the depth of the folders, except that the path name+file cannot exceed 256 bytes
No issue with long file names, the memsub_malloc() has 65k roughly allocated per directory listing, just be mindful of the overall path+filename length
* Added *.gbc in addition to *.gb files to selection menu
* Added directories to selection menu, can now explore subdirectories
* Adjusted default SGB palettes for Pokemon Blue/Red; previous fix required adjustment of these two titles.
09.06.2024:v0.66
* Added Max and Min audio quality settings, 6 and 72 sample intervals respectively
* Added 12 colour Analogue Pocket palette for Kirbys Pinball Land
* Added 12 colour Analogue Pocket palette for Donkey Kong Land
* Added SGB border and palette for Donkey Kong Land
* Added Cardputer Arcade cabinet border, available for all games
08.06.2024:
* Silver has been tested, must rename to .gb from .gbc
06.06.2024:v0.65
* increased paged memory limit to 2megs to accommodate Pokemon Gold/Silver
* Gold has been tested, must rename to .gb from .gbc
* increased specificity of error messages regarding paging
04.06.2024:v0.64
* Fixed bug with setting initial super gameboy palettes
* Added Pokemon Yellow SGB Border and AP Community Palette
* Added Supermario land 2 SGB border
* Added Tetris SGB border
* Added Final Fantasy Legends SGB Palette and Border, added 12 colour Analogue Pocket palette
* Pokemon Blue border is now scaled using simple pixel scaling method (same as all other borders) to preserve pixelized look
* Gameboy border left border has been adjusted
03.06.2024:v0.63
* Added audio quality setting (high,med,low, update intervals of 12,24 and 36 audio samples)
* Added startup audio volume setting (default is mute)
* Added interlacing setting
* Added new settings to configuration files; old configuration files are always supported, and will be upgraded to the newest version when the settings are saved for the first time.
* Squished another bug; timed events weren't taking into account time for border drawing/clearing
* Fixed crash from settings menu when accessed from main menu, settings are saved on game launch or if changed mid game. Crash was related to saving within the file picker.
02.06.2024:v0.622
* Added mute and volume half/max contols to Fn+Left/Right keys
01.05.2024:v0.621
* Experimented with an inline version of the ganeboy CPU its various functions but they yeilded no performance gain
* CPU step loop moved inside of peanut_gb to reduce function calls, essentially the same as inline but with no memory penalty
30.05.2024.v0.62
* Audio rendering has been made faster updating every 24 by default samples, was twelve; 24 will be the default (a.k.a. medium quality) sligt reduction in quality when frame rate dips low can be noticed at 36; may make option for audio quality. Updating every 36 samples seems
to be the minimum(clicking becomes more likely beyond this update interval), so 12,24,36 seem to be appropriate settings; every 12 sameples was used in 6.0 may added higher and lower quality settings in future
* Adjusted TTL logic to run seperately from the page retrieval so that retrieving data is as fast as possible when in memory.
29.05.2024:v0.61
* Memory solution devised was based on two ideas: Assume stastically random access patterns, and place no limits on addressable space.
The reality is that the gameboy games never exceed 8megabits (1megabyte); Taking advantage of the limitations of the gameboy, I have removed the generalized nature of the	previous solution in favor of one that provides a deterministic approach to page seeking, with the tradeoff that no games larger than a real game boy game can be loaded any longer. This should not pose an issue for any (valid) title. This has increased frame rates slightly all around and made them much steadier; page location has no bearing on access times. Page seek times are fixed, and a minor amount of page maintenance is done at these intervals, distributed across successive calls still. This would be deterministic page seeking mixed with the previous progressive pruning.
* Added Error messages with regards to writing save game files, attempts to do so when there is no cart ram
* Added Error messages specific to the case of being unable to open a file vs. file size 0 (was ambiguous before)
* Removed pause associated with automatic savegames; bars operate on a timer now and will disappear 1second after pending write is completed

28.05.2024:v0.601
* No longer will create save files or allow save files to be created for titles without cart ram(0b files no more)

27.05.2024:v0.6
* Audio is fully implemented. Inaccuratley, built for speed. Hardly any impact of rendering.
Note: While the tones will not change pitch as a title slows down, music will speed up and slow down along with frame rates.
* Implemented volume up/down controls attached to Fn+up/down arrows. If these are mapped to controls, at this time, it will respond to both.
Further Note: I put no limits on control configuration. Make everything a single button if you want.
* Added cessation of audio rendering when volume is set to 0.
26.05.2024:v0.57
* alterered APU to allow variable amounts of time between calls
* Tuned APU performance to get first recognizable gameplay sounds out of the emulator.
25.05.2024:v0.56
* Added 12color AP palette mapping for Links Awakening
* Added SGB border for Pokemon Red
* Added SGB border for Links Awakening
* Added notification for titles with Analogue Pocket profile, but no SGB profile
* Work on audio playback engine has begun, core 0 continusoly feeds audio from a buffer to the speaker; a test 1000hz sine wave shows little to no stuttering while emulator runs, needs tuning. Disabled until apu work complete.
23.05.2024:v0.53
* Required memory for pokemon +5k just incase has been made available
* Implemented 12-color Analogue Pocket palettes for Pokemon Red/Blue
* Implemented preset SGB and GBC palettes for Pokemon Red/Blue
* Implemented SGB borders for Pokemon Blue
* disabled audio for this release; exported to wav file to examine and while its the same code
it is not generating the same output as the PC test version. Will take further research.
22.05.2025:v0.52
* Implemented audio with peanut_gb hooks on PC (version for debugging); verified APU core and waveforms
* Integrated Audio with peanut_gb hooks on ESP32; audio waveforms are now being generated, needs balancing with CPU and speaker playback still

21.05.2024:v0.51
* implemented main emulator function as a task on core 1 and a second persistent task on core 0 via RTOS; this is in preparation to acommodate the APU engine
* core 0 thread must call vTaskDelay as there are vital threads on that core, which if not attented to, will cause a restart. I dont have full use of this core.
* discovered pokemon starts working if I have more free memory so I suspect I run out of stack space. 180k paging it works 200 it doesn't will calculate requied amount

20.05.2024:v0.5
* added bottom menu bar with instructions to the main rom selection menu, pres ESC or ' key (same thing) to enter the settings menu either from the main menu or while playing a game
* added options menu, can be entered from the menu or from within a game; displays the 8 main controls with their current setting, saves settings when closed
* added restore defaults for config menu
* settings are saved to gbconfig.dat; delete this if you are having any issues

19.05.2024:v0.492
* Reimplemented memory subsystem to use progressive partial page seeking/pruning; the original memory management code was the first I had typed in 14 years; after some thought I devised something much more suitable for a real time environment. This resulted in the average page seek time being much lower, and distributes maintenance of the paging system across successive calls. The results are the largest improvement to speed to date. Over double the frame rates from before; less stutter, smoother page transitions in memory. Donkey Kong Land averages around 45fps now; Super Mario land 2 gets an average 53fps on the overworld.

18.05.2024:v0.491
* Reduced rendering workload 6.25% by modifying peanut_gb to inherently skip lines that aren't visible due to scaling.
This prevents the engine from having to process the layer and sprite data for these lines all together. Why 6.25%? because 9 lines are skipped which is 6.25% of the lines that were rendered previously.

17.05.2024:v0.49 
* Refactored graphics code; ~120,000 less operations a frame
* Scrolling behaviour and screen content differences no longer effect rendering performance Titles such as final fantasy or even super mario land 2 show a huge improvement in overworld movement speed.

17.05.2024: v0.483 Pushing this now as a BUG FIX RELEASE
* Fixed bug in main menu causing selection to only move upward; you can now navigate properly again.
* added FPS display while Fn button is held, causes slow down which is subtracted from the FPS display. This is so I can evaluate performance improvements more than anything else, but it doesn't hurt to have so I'm leaving it in.
* new borders are on hold while I make decisions about the internal format (leaning towards argb1555,presently 565)
16.05.2024: v0.482
* Added Analogue Pocket 12color palette category with 44 palettes
* Automatic 12color(AP) palettes mapped as per Analogue Pocket suggested mappings for:
	Mario 1/2/Wario Land/Balloon Kid/F1 Race/Tetris
* added Cottage Daytime SGB border
* Fixed 12colours not being assigned until palette select bug
* regularly mapped controller up/down/a now functions in addition to arrow/enter keys in main menu to allow a single hand posture for the entire interface if desired.

15.05.2024: v0.481
* proper DMG-01 startup sequence, may help compatibility with some games.
* Message boxes now will display any emulation errors reported by peanut_gb
* Attempts to access ROM address outside of the available cartridge ROM will display an appropriate message

14.05.2024 v0.48 Added 12 colour mode, with the 12 palettes the game boy colour could apply to old game boy games as the first of this mode, but more to come in this area.
*Super gameboy support added for screen borders with gameboy skin set as default, followed by 1 (for now) of the official borders from the hardware itself. Activate by holding Fn and pressing '[' and cycle borders by holding Fn and pressing ']'. Because these are the same keys used for other visual modifications, I hope using the combination of Fn and these keys is intuitive.
* Super gameboy palette support added for balloon kid, the legend of zelda links awakening and kirbys pinball land
* Various other small tweaks you probably wont notice.

12.06.2025 V0.47 Added first iteration of Super Gameboy Mode with all 32 official palettes that were included with the original hardware. Nintendo included a table on the device to map certain games to certain palettes, and that functionality is partially implemented. Mario 1/2/Wario Land, F1 Racer and Tetris all autodetect and assign their colour scheme. This mode can be toggled on and off at any time during play with the '[' button, and the current cycle palette button will cycle through the 32 included palettes. Games with defined profiles with start with that palette selected automatically when Super Gameboy Mode is engaged for the first time each session. 
*Lots of user interface changes; message boxes will appear to describe your palette selections, among other things - no console style debug remains in normal operation.
*Another 4k of memory allocated to ROM storage, may smooth out some edge cases of stuttering.
*Improved readability in the main menu; and made highlighted selection more apparent.
*Added smooth transitions to splash screen.
*Disabled unused (for the moment) configuration file

11,05.2024:: 0.44 squished a bug, added palette control, press ']' to cycle between presets.
b/w, gameboy(original), gameboy pocket and gameboy light (in that order).
Huge performance improvements for larger ROMs with over 110k more ram available to the memory sub-system. Palette values are from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_video_game_console_palettes for accuracy.

10.05.2024:: 0.41 added savegame support. if a game uses it's onboard ram constantly though, use the manual backup button (=). The save feature will only automatically engage after the cartridge ram has been left untouched for a second.

Yellow bars on either side of the display momentarily indicate that the cartridge ram has been backed up. The savegame format will not be changing, its a simple binary dump.

Controls(in game):
left/right use 'a' and 'd'
up/down use 'e' and 's'
A/B use 'l' and 'k'
start/select use '1' and '0'
cycle palette in current mode use the ] square bracket
cycle between classic gameboy,super gameboy & 12 color modes [
quicksave/savestate press del/backspace key
quickload/loadstate press minus/underscore key
force cart ram backup  press '=' (if uncertain of gamesave use this)
turn on super gameboy border at any time by pressing Fn+'['
cycle through border options by pressing Fn+']'
Display current FPS by holding Fn; it will appear in 1 second and update every second there after, can cause some slowdown but that is accounted for in the FPS count.
Press `/esc in the main menu or during gameplay for settings menu
Mute audio using Fn+left arrow
Raise audio to 50% then 100% using Fn+right arrow
Change volume using Fn+up/down arrow keys for granular control

Have fun!

name: Infiltra 0.5 Release M5STICKCPLUS2
description:
CHANGE LOG BELOW: 
🚀 Flash Signal X: https://infiltra.xyz
🌐 GitHub:https://github.com/D3CRYPT-1/Infiltra-Firmware
💬 Join the Discord: https://discord.gg/r7QzDmsbyd

Changelog for Signal X 0.5 Dev Release – M5StickC Plus v1.1 & v2

New Features & Enhancements:
	•	Full Compatibility with M5StickC Plus 1.1 & 2 – Optimized performance and stability.
	•	UI Themes – Customizable interface themes for better personalization.
	•	IR Mods Support – Now supports M5 IR transmitter & receiver, G26 IR devices, and internal IR.
	•	RF Mods Support – Works with M5 RF transmitter & receiver, all G26 RF mods, and CC1101 (limited support).
	•	Custom Frequency Selection – Enables switching between different bands for scanning and transmission.
	•	Enhanced Deauth Packets – Improved packet handling for more reliable deauthentication attacks.
	•	Upgraded Packet Sniffer – Enhanced signal detection & band frequency analysis.
	•	RF Jammer Update:
	•	Sweep Mode – Jams all supported RF frequencies.
	•	Target Mode – Locks onto a selected frequency for precise jamming.

Bug Fixes & Stability Improvements:
	•	Wi-Fi & BLE Scanning Fixes – Improved stability and accuracy.
	•	IR Spam Exit Fix – Users can now properly exit IR spam mode.
	•	Memory Stability Fix – Resolved memory allocation issues causing resets.
	•	Optimized Input Handling – Eliminated lag and improved menu responsiveness.
	•	Power Management Tweaks – Enhanced efficiency, reducing unnecessary power drain.
	•	Expanded Device Support – Better compatibility for ESP32-based boards.
	•	Packet Logging Improvements – More accurate and reliable logging for Wi-Fi & RF data.
	•	Fixed Occasional Freezes – Addressed system hangs when switching attack modes.

🚀 Flash Signal X: https://signalx.ddns.net/
🌐 GitHub:https://github.com/D3CRYPT-1/Signal-X-Firmware
💬 Join the Discord: https://discord.gg/r7QzDmsbyd
author: D3CRYPT.

name: M5 Atom Matrix - Companion Satellite
description:
m5-atom-satellite

Connect m5 Atom Matrix devices to Bitfocus Companion using the Satellite API.

This is released as-is, in both Arduino Sketch format, as as a precompiled hex file.

Flashing
The easiest way to get started is to flash the included hex file, this can be done using esptool.py or your ES32 flashing tool of choice. This file should be flashed at offset 0x0, i.e. in esptool, you can use the following command from the directory you downloaded the hex file to.

esptool.py --chip ESP32 write_flash 0x0 m5-atom-satellite.hex
Configuration
On first boot, the Atom Matrix will create a WiFi network starting with 'm5Atom-' and a semi-unique code. Join this network and configure at IP 192.168.4.1 if the captive portal doesn't load automatically.

If connection to WiFi fails, the portal will autostart. It can be manually started by holding the button for 5 seconds if you are not connected to companion (when you see the 4 blue corner lights, they will turn purple to indicate portal reopened). This is useful if you are connected to WiFi but need to change networks or Companion IP.

The Config page lets you enter your Companion IP, port should remain at default for now.

RGB LED Connection
You can add a RGB LED from Jaycar.com.au to the rear on the following pins to mirror the array: const int LED_PIN_RED = 33; // External LED red channel const int LED_PIN_GREEN = 22; // External LED green channel const int LED_PIN_BLUE = 19; // External LED blue channel const int LED_PIN_GND = 23; // External LED ground pin

name: M5Cardputer WebRadio FR
description:
M5Cardputer WebRadio FR version
WiFi Settings will be stored in EEPROM
PlatformIO IDE used. (VS code)

Difficult to use an SD card for URL storage: The classic dilemma on ESP32:

Wi-Fi after SPI/SD_card = Wi-Fi fails
SPI/SD after Wi-Fi = SD fails
Why? On some boards like the M5Cardputer, SD access is done via HSPI, while Wi-Fi uses DMA/interrupts from the main bus. → When SD is initialized after Wi-Fi, the SPI bus or GPIO pins may conflict.

Implemented solution: Use an HTTP GET request to retrieve the list of channels: web-streams come from http://philae.synology.me/~admin/arduino/radio_dico.php

name: M5Core2_SimpleClock
description:
M5Stack M5Core2 Simple Clock

This is a very simple clock for the M5Core2
Usage

    Change parameters of ntpServer/gmtOffset_sec/daylightOffset_sec to your needs

    Change the WiFi mode as you wish, SMARTMODE = esp smartconfig, FIXEDMODE = static WiFi credentials

    Compile and push to the M5Core2

    M5Core2 will now show time based on the RTC time

    Touch the lower half of the M5Core2-LCD to bring up the menu icons

Menuicons

    WIFI Smart connect (touch on it [you see the clock stop], then press confirm on the ESP SmartConfig app on your phone, the icon will turn green if WIFI is done

    Time Sync (If WiFi icon is green, touch the TimeSync icon once), the icon will turn green if sync is done

    Close Menu (will hide the menu icons and disable the touch areas for the 3 icons)

Known problems

sometimes the WiFi is not working as expected, I tried to fix this by
restarting the complete WiFi but I'm not sure if this helps
I think this is some ESP32 issue, that sometimes cannot connect to WiFi

As I began with ESP chips I resetted the whole chip by using ESP.restart();
So this is my first attempt to fix it otherwise

Support for the M5Stack Core S3 is still experimental. By the way, the M5Stack Core S3 only supports Bluetooth 5.0 (BLE - Bluetooth Low Energy), but not anymore Bluetooth 4.2 (Classic). Utilizing as a base the Official M5Cardputer-UserDemo project and the project https://github.com/WuSiYu/M5Cardputer-UserDemo-Plus, I created a new M5Cardputer-UserDemo Fallout-PipBoy Edition.

Instructions:

Set Wifi to get SNTP time.
Press G0 Button to go home in any app.

Still in development... More updates for the project coming soon!

name: Manual Flash Calculator - ATOMS3
description:
v1.0.0:

If you use manual flash in your camera, this will calculate the settings to get the right exposure.

Inputs:

- Tilt left and right: Change the distance from the flash to the subject. Aperture is calculated based on GN, ISO, flash power and distance.
- Double click: Cycles through parameters for editing (GN, ISO, flash power and LCD brightness).
- Single click: Cycles through available values for the parameter that it's currently set for editing. GN from 1 to 64, ISO from 50 to 6400, flash power from 1/128 to full power, and 4 levels of brightness.
- Long click: Locks distance wheel, so you can adjust other settings and see the lens aperture value recalculated.

To save your current GN, ISO, flash power and brightness settings on the non-volatile memory, set the editing box on the brightness indicator and do a long click. This will save your config and reset the device.

v1.1.0:

- Added snap to distance wheel. Click when no other setting is selected and it will cycle through "no snap", 0.25m, 0.5m and 1m snap.
author: anibarro

name: Manual Flash Calculator - M5StickC Plus2
description:
v1.1.0:
Added basic battery level and turn off count down.

v1.0.0:
Adaptation from the AtomS3 version to use the extra screen space.
If you use manual flash on your camera, this will calculate the settings to get the right exposure.

Inputs:
- Tilt left and right: Change the distance from the flash to the subject. Aperture is calculated based on GN, ISO, flash power and distance.
- Click Button B (right side): Cycles through parameters for editing (GN, ISO, flash power and LCD brightness).
- Click Button A (central): Cycles through available values for the parameter that it's currently set for editing. GN from 1 to 64, ISO from 50 to 6400, flash power from 1/128 to full power, and 4 levels of brightness.
  When no setting is selected, it will cycle through "no snap", 0.25m, 0.5m and 1m snap.
- Long click Button A: Locks distance wheel, so you can adjust other settings and see the lens aperture value recalculated.
  Long click will save your current GN, ISO, flash power and brightness settings on the non-volatile memory when editing brightness. It will save your config and reset the device.

name: MicroHydra for Cardputer
description:
You should erase the flash before flashing this firmware for the first time.
IF YOU RUN INTO ISSUES: hold G0 as you plug it in to enter download mode. You'll then be able to re-flash this, or something new.  
Check out the wiki on the GitHub, if you have any questions :)

MicroHydra is an app switcher designed for MicroPython, with the goal of making it easy to create and switch between apps coded in MicroPython. It also provides some handy 'OS-like' features via a few built-in apps.

.py/.mpy files can be placed in the "apps" folder on the flash, or on an sdcard. There is also a new "getapps" builtin app for downloading from the community apps repo.

Check the GitHub if you have questions :) it has a community wiki going, along with a link to the app repo.

name: OpenWiFi Scanner
description:
This tool continuously scans for open networks, searching for internet access, and generates a report of the surrounding Wi-Fi networks. It displays the detected networks, categorized by their security status.

SCREEN:
- Green: Indicates networks that provide open access to the internet.
- White: Indicates networks that are open without encryption but may not provide internet access.
- Orange: Indicates networks that use outdated or weak encryption, potentially at risk.
- Red: Indicates networks that are securely encrypted and protected.

LED:
- Green LED: Lights up when open networks or networks with web access are detected.
- Orange LED: Lights up when vulnerable networks are detected.
- Red LED: Lights up when only closed networks are found.

SPEAKER:
- One bip tone: Plays when a vulnerable network is detected.
- Two bip Tone: Plays when an open network is found.
- Melody tone: Plays when a web access network is available.


Disclaimer:

This tool is intended solely for educational and security purposes. It is designed to help users understand and assess the security of Wi-Fi networks. Do not use this tool to attempt unauthorized access to private networks. Unauthorized access to networks is illegal and unethical. Always obtain proper permission from the network owner before performing any scans or security assessments.

name: PORTAL.HACK DEMO M5STICKC PLUS
description:
### PORTAL.HACK DEMO Firmware

#### Introduction
This demo version of the PORTAL.HACK firmware is designed for security demonstrations and experimental testing. It includes a limited selection of advanced features, such as a depowered RF jammer, the Windows BLE Bad-USB attack, and various test WiFi and BLE functions. This firmware is developed for use with the M5StickC Plus and M5StickC Plus 2 devices, leveraging the capabilities of the ESP32 microcontroller through the Arduino IDE.

#### Included Features

1. **RF Jammer (Depowered)**
   - **Description**: Temporarily disrupts nearby radio signals in a controlled and limited manner.
   - **Usage**: Ideal for testing the effectiveness of RF security countermeasures in controlled environments without causing extensive interference.
   - **Hardware**: Requires the MX-RM-5V receiver module connected to pin 25 and the FS1000A transmitter module connected to pin 26.

2. **Windows BLE Bad-USB**
   - **Description**: Utilizes the M5StickC device to execute "BadUSB" attacks via Bluetooth.
   - **Usage**: The device creates a Wi-Fi network that you can connect to, then access the link http://172.0.0.1/ to input commands, which will be executed when the M5StickC is connected to a Windows PC via USB.

3. **WiFi and BLE Test Functions**
   - **WiFi Scan**: Scans for nearby WiFi networks and displays details such as SSID, signal strength, and security protocols.
   - **BLE Scan**: Scans for nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices, showing available devices and their characteristics.

#### Note
This firmware is intended for professional, educational, and demonstration purposes only. Unauthorized use of these features can violate laws and regulations. Always use responsibly and ethically.

author: viniciusbo

name: Palnagotchi for M5 Atom S3(R) Dev Kit
description:
A friendly unit for those lonely Pwnagotchis out there. It's written to run on the M5 Atom S3(R) Dev Kit.

This is a fork of viniciusbo's Palnagotchi for the M5 Cardputer.

He reverse engineered the Pwngrid advertisement protocol and made it possible for the Cardputer to advertise to the Pwngrid as a Pwnagotchi. All brain policy parameters that could negatively impact AI learning were removed from the advertisemenet data.

The Pwngrid works by sending Wifi beacon frames with a JSON serialized payload in Wifi AC headers, containing the Pwnagotchi's data (name, face, pwns, brain policy between others). That's how nearby Pwnagotchis can detect and also learn each other. By crafting a custom beacon frame, this app can appear as a Pwnagotchi to other Pwnagotchis.

name: QuickLink-LoRaWAN470-Gateway
description: The program is composed of M5 BASIC host and Module LoRa (433MHz), which realizes the basic functions of the LoRaWAN470 gateway (single channel and sf). Its main function is: (1) Receive LoRa data packets from the LoRaWAN470 node (QuickLink-LoRaWAN470-Node), convert into UDP data packets and upload to TTN (Uplink). (2) Receive UDP packets from TTN, convert into LoRa packets and send to the LoRaWAN470 node (Downlink). Users can configure the WiFi SSID and password, change the frequency and datarate and modify the LoRaWAN server address through burnerNVS.
author: M5Stack

name: QuickLink-LoRaWAN470-Node
description: The program is composed of M5 BASIC host, Module LoRa (433MHz) and ENV-II Unit, which realizes the basic functions of the LoRaWAN470 node. Users can collect temperature and humidity data by the ENV-II Unit and communicate with TTN through the LoRaWAN gateway (QuickLink-LoRaWAN470-Gateway). Users can configure the join mode (OTAA, ABP), frequency, datarate, power and transmission interval through burnerNVS to adapt different usage environments.

name: RF433/R/T
description:
The firmware is under development.

Functions:

RF433 Reading:

Select this option to read RF433MHz signals.
The device will display "Reading..." and wait for a signal.
When a signal is received, it will display the frequency in MHz.
Press button A or button C to return to the menu.

RF433 Emitter:

This function requires a valid frequency to be captured first.
If no valid frequency is captured, it will display a message indicating so.
If a valid frequency is available, it will emit a signal at that frequency.
Press button C to return to the menu.

RF433 Custom:

Allows manual control of the frequency.
Use button A to start transmitting at the current frequency.
Use button B to adjust the frequency. Press and hold to increase, press briefly to decrease.
The frequency range is from 432.500 MHz to 434.000 MHz.
Press button C to return to the menu.

The device will start with a menu displaying three options: "RF433 reading", "RF433 emitter", and "RF433 Custom".

Use button B to cycle through these options.
Use button A to select an option.
Use button C to return to the main menu from any operation.

This repository contains the code to turn the M5Stack Cardputer into a WiFi hotspot, providing a web interface stored on the SD card and a back-end API for interaction.

The project creates a WiFi server on the Cardputer, allowing connected devices to access:

Front-end: HTML pages stored in the Front-end folder on the SD card.

Back-end: API developed in C++ stored in the Back-end folder on the SD card.



Este repositório contém o código para transformar o M5Stack Cardputer em um ponto de acesso WiFi, fornecendo uma interface web armazenada no cartão SD e uma API back-end para interação.

O projeto cria um servidor WiFi no Cardputer, permitindo que dispositivos conectados acessem:

Front-end: Páginas HTML armazenadas na pasta Front-end do cartão SD.
Back-end: API desenvolvida em C++ armazenada na pasta Back-end do cartão SD.

Embark on a thrilling space survival adventure game with Nora. Cada decisión que tomes determinará su destino: ¿logrará escapar de la nave condenada? name: StackChan(MP3-Player) for Cardputer
description:
NOW STACKCHAN CAN PLAY MP3 FILES CONTINUOUSLY AND NEW FACES HAVE BEEN ADDED. ADDED THE FUNCTION TO ADJUST SCREEN BRIGHTNESS. Keys (-) and (=).  ADDED SHUFFLE. Key - (s) 

!!! Brightness Fix !!!

StackChan came to liven up the cardputer's downtime when you're not using it for other things or when it's charging, and now it can groove to MP3s in the background. !!! READ MORE BELOW !!!

This means that when the device is recharging, it won't have a static background, and now you can listen to music while enjoying StackChan's cuteness.

Tip:
When a title balloon is being displayed, press any key to make it disappear.

Controls:

- Key 1 to change the faces
- Key 2 to change the background color
- Key 3 to change the expression 
- Press the '-' key to decrease brightness  
- Press the '=' key to increase brightness.

How to use MP3 Function:

- Copy MP3 files to the SD card, then insert it into the cardputer.
- Turn on the cardputer and wait a few seconds for it to scan.
- Press the (BtnGo) to play music.
- For the next song, press (BtnGo).
- Volume UP: press arrow up (;) 
- Volume DOWN: press arrow down (.)
- N for Next song
- B Previous song
- P Pause/Play
- S Shuffle ON/OFF


Note: still in development!!!

Libraries Dependencies:

- https://github.com/meganetaaan/m5stack-avatar
- https://github.com/earlephilhower/ESP8266Audio/

name: Timer Camera X网络视频服务器
description:
该固件为Arduino IDE默认测试程序CameraWebServer可以通过网页在线配置摄像头滤镜镜像等，可以通过该固件轻松获取视频流或者实时照片，关于该固件的更多实用用法见默言博客，点击下方GitHub图标直达博客。
固件使用步骤如下:
1、烧录该固件并通过M5 NVS配网
2、打开串口监视器，连接Timer Camera X串口并重启开发板
3、通过串口监视器或者路由器后台查看IP地址
4、浏览器访问设备IP地址进入摄像头Web管理后台进行使用

注意事项：
一般来说图片分辨率越高视频流帧率越低
通过水平镜像或者垂直镜像设置不同方向
视频流地址http://<IP地址>:81/stream
实时照片地址http://<IP地址>/capture

NVS配置需要先初始化NVS
wifi名称配置SSID
wifi密码配置PASS

UPDATE 1.1 : Add USB HID Keyboard and Mouse

Implements a USB and Bluetooth BLE HID device capable of emulating both a keyboard and a mouse.

- Mode : Toggle GO button (on the edge) to change between Keyboard and Mouse

name: Ultimate Remote
description:
A powerful universal remote control for the M5Cardputer, supporting 3498 remote profiles from 636 different manufacturers and containing around 30,000 commands. It allows you to easily find a suitable remote for you device thanks to a automatic remotes scan.

!! NEW !! - UPDATE 1.2 : Support for the Flipper-IRDB, read .ir files form SD card, also new remotes added.

## Key Features

- Extensive Database: Contains 3498 remote profiles from 636 different manufacturers.
- Protocol Support: Works with more than 60 infrared protocols.
- Massive Command Set: Supports around 30,000 commands.
- Read .ir files from SD card (See Github to get theses files).
- Scan and Find: Allows you to scan for and find the correct remote from a particular manufacturer.
- Favorites: Easily add remotes by pressing SPACE on any remote add it to your favorites.
- Navigation: Navigate through different manufacturer folders to view all available remotes and save them.

## Keybinds

Remote's shortcuts are automatically assigned, however, keys like POWER will always have the shortcut 'P', CHANNEL_UP and CHANNEL_DOWN will always be '[' and ']', and VOL_UP and VOL_DOWN will always be '-+', the same goes for KEY_0 to KEY_9 and some others frequently used commands.
author: geo_tp

name: Ultrasonic Wind Sensor - ULSA M5B (Demo Firmware)
description:
This firmware is a demonstration firmware for the ULSA M5B, an ultrasonic anemometer that can stack with the M5Stack Core2.
It provides a wind speed and direction gauge, as well as a wind direction correction feature using the Bosch 9-axis sensor BNO055 built into the ULSA.
This firmware is compatible with Core2, Core2 for AWS, and Core2 V1.1.


[Version 2.0 - 2024/08/04]

 - Supports BLE wireless connection
 - Supports automatic time synchronization via BLE (syncs with the built-in RTC)
 - Supports CSV data logging to an SD card

By accessing the ULSA BLE site using the Web Bluetooth API (https://strvsn.net/P5/ULSA_BLE/), wireless measurement and wireless logging via the browser are possible.

Supported browsers:
PC: Chrome, Edge
Android: Chrome
iOS: Bluefy (logging function not supported)

name: hi5stack m5stack papers3 m5papers3
description: The hi5stack project is a modular firmware designed for M5Stack Paper or M5PaperS3 devices. It features a flexible architecture with support for user interface management, SD card operations, button handling, customizable settings, and modular extensions for applications, screens, services, keyboards, and network connectivity. The device can be used as a customizable badge: you can attach a BMP image or a TXT file to the device and carry it as a badge, with files stored on the SD card for easy personalization and display. Also includes an SD Gateway feature: a built-in web interface accessible over Wi-Fi. SD Gateway allows you to upload, delete, batch delete, and directly edit .txt and .json files on the SD card from any browser on the same network, making file management and device personalization fast and convenient.

name: m5stack-file-server
description:
m5stack-file-server is software that transforms an M5Stack device into a Web File Server operating on a WiFi network. You can easily manage files on the SD card or internal SPIFFS through a web browser.
#  Setup and Usage  # 
1. Create a file named `wifi.txt` in the root directory of the SD card with the following format:
  your_wifi_ssid
  your_wifi_ssid_password
  your_server_name

2.  Access:
 Power on the M5Stack. It will connect to WiFi, and the IP address and server name will be displayed on the Monitor.  Open a web browser on a PC or smartphone connected to the same network and navigate to the displayed IP address (`http://<IP_address>/`) or the mDNS name (`http://<server_name>/` ) .

3. Operation:
 Use the menus and buttons on the displayed web interface to perform file operations and view system information.

name: uart buddy
description:
This software is part of the integrated training developed by Julio Della Flora (@juliodellaflora on Instagram) and is designed to assist hardware hackers in discovering and interacting with UART (Universal Asynchronous Receiver-Transmitter) serial ports on embedded devices using an M5Stack device. The program allows users to toggle between various common UART baud rates, enabling communication with different serial devices. It also sends commands like "help" via the UART connection to test responses and displays the received data in real-time on the M5Stack's screen.

The baud rates supported include 9600, 115200, 230400, 256000, 512000, and 921600. The tool logs all UART activity, saving the logs to an SD card for later review. Additionally, the M5Stack’s screen displays real-time status, such as the battery level, and logs are printed on the screen as data is received. The software uses buttons to switch baud rates and trigger data transmission, making it an intuitive interface for exploring UART connections in embedded devices.

This software is part of the free training developed by Julio Della Flora (@juliodellaflora on Instagram), and you can check out the full training at the following link
author: jcldf

name: world market clock
description:
It is a 24-hour clock for employees or managers of import/export companies, and those who work in trade clerical work.

The analog clock shows Greenwich Mean Time and the digital clock shows the three major markets of the world:New York,London and Tokyo. The clock face(background) displays the trading hours of each country's market and a map centered on the North Pole.(The hour hand(short hand) indicates the position of the sun.)
It seems that there is still no world clock that integrates these four elements and displays them. There is no complexity at all, rather it is intuitive to see and understand, and it greatly helps you to image the local time and trading situation of each market around the world.

Local time is displayed at the right of the clock face, and rate of 4 major currencies(3 currency pairs) are displayed in real time.
The LED on the side changes color according to market fluctuations(green→orange→red). Even if you don't pay attention to the rate numbers all the time, it is possible to grasp the mood of the market.
In addition, the world clock automatically switches between standard time, daylight saving time, and trading time display for each country's market under the following conditions.

Second Sunday in March: New York, Toronto, Chicago. Transition to daylight saving time.
Last Sunday in March: London, Zurich, Frankfurt. Transition to daylight saving time.
First Sunday in April: Wellington, Sydney. Transition to standard time.
Last Sunday in September: Wellington. Transition to dylight saving time.
Last Sunday in October: London, Zurich, Frankfurt. Transition to standard time.
First Sunday in November: New York, Toronto, Chicago. Transition to standard time.

There is also a normal world clock mode that does not display currency rates, and a local time display mode (used when setting local time).

Requires an SD card. Also download the clock face image ZIP on github.
A detailed explanation is also written on github.

name: 创意点阵时钟（2合1）
description:
引脚定义:
连接4合1点阵DIN→19 CLK→21 CS→22
固定低电平引脚32
模式选择引脚33(悬空为普通模式，低电平为悬浮模式)
个性化显示取模网站
http://maker.peien.xyz/clock/
普通取模逆向 悬浮顺向

使用步骤:
1、按要求连接点阵与按需选择模式将GPIO33悬空或接地选择模式
2、上电设备开启名称为M5_XXX的热点，XXX为设备MAC地址，连接该热点，浏览器输入192.168.4.1进入在线配置页面，配置网络与显示亮度
3、配置完成断电重启自动联网后可通过路由器分配的IP地址在线配置与使用

默认设置
网络Netcore-65080F密码1234567890
亮度1

name: 多模态小智助手
description: 弥补小智官方AtomS3R-CAM没有按钮打断的遗憾，使用GPIO1唤醒或者打断，唤醒会有语音反馈。GPIO2快捷问答，问答提示词拍一张照片，如果有红绿灯告诉我，当前红绿灯状态，如果是道路告诉我通行建议，如果是书籍或者卡片帮我识别文字内容，如果是车牌告诉我车牌号，其他情况帮我描述图片内容。两个按钮都是上拉模式低电平有效，可以直接使用M5两路按钮模块直插使用。

name: 悬浮创意点阵时钟
description:
固件使用步骤如下:
1、连接4合1点阵DIN→19 CLK→21 CS→22
2、烧录该固件并通过M5 NVS配网
3、重启开始使用悬浮创意精灵时钟
author: peien

name: 悬浮点阵时钟plus
description:
该固件与上一版本相比增加了时钟的控制API
可以通过网络get请求时钟IP地址提交参数控制
时钟的亮度以及显示32x8的位图
参数定义如下：
state（定义显示时间或者显示位图，值为1显示时间，值为0显示位图）
image（显示位图的16进制数据，高度必须为8宽度0-32的位图，显示位图state参数必为0）
luminance（显示亮度范围0-10，0为最暗而不是不亮）
固件使用步骤如下:
1、连接4合1点阵DIN→19 CLK→21 CS→22
2、烧录该固件并通过M5 NVS配网
3、重启开始使用悬浮创意精灵时钟
4、通过设备IP加提交参数控制悬浮创意精灵时钟（例如http://192.168.0.110?state=0&image=0x20, 0x60, 0xC8, 0xDB, 0xDB, 0xC8, 0x60, 0x20, 0x00, 0x00, 0x0E, 0x18, 0xBE, 0x6D, 0x3C, 0x6D, 0xBE, 0x18, 0x0E&luminance=2）
增加网络未连接超时60秒重启（适用于已连接但由于网络波动等情况造成的意外断开等情况，此种情况，网络环境并未改变）
author: peien

name: 阅读卡片 | EDC Book
description:
【软件信息】
阅读卡片/EDC Book。一款基于M5 PaperS3的墨水屏阅读器软件。

1.03更新日志：
[修复] 修复连续多次翻页后概率出现半空白页的问题（1.02引入）
[优化] 显著降低阅读界面的待机功耗（约为上一个版本的1/3）
[优化] 交换设置时间的按钮的左右顺序（现在左边是减，右边是加）
[优化] 优化自定义关机图片的显示效果
[优化] 优化文件名过长时导航栏的显示效果
[特性] 新增英文界面支持（开机页面左上角）
[特性] 翻页模式现在支持：左-右、右-左、上-下三种（点击区域，上一页/下一页）

刷机会导致当前的读书进度和配置修改被清空。请知！

【更多信息】
http://edcbook.cn

---------------------------

【Software Information】
Reading Card / EDC Book. An e-ink reader application based on M5 PaperS3.

v1.03 Changelog:
[Fix] Fixed intermittent half-blank pages after rapid page turns (issue introduced in v1.02)
[Optimization] Reduced standby power consumption by 67% in reading interface
[Optimization] Swapped time-setting button positions (now [-] left / [+] right)
[Optimization] Enhanced display quality for custom power-off images
[Optimization] Improved navigation bar display for long file names
[Feature] Added English UI support (toggle at top-left corner of boot screen)
[Feature] Added three page turn modes: 
  • L-R (Left-Right)
  • R-L (Right-Left)
  • T-B (Top-Bottom)

Flashing this firmware will reset all reading progress and configuration settings. Please note!

【More Information】
http://edcbook.cn
author: mengxiyou

name: ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ BTスピーカー bluetooth-simple (CORE2 for AWS & CORE2 V1.1)
description:
Ver3.1：LEDエフェクトをマルチタスク対応にし負荷分散化しました。

ｱｦｯｺさん仕様をアップロードしました。LED 70弾に対応しました。ネコミミLEDで遊べます。
エフェクト切り替えは、ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝの顔中央左側をタップして変更します。(それぞれのエフェクトはGitHubにリンク貼りました。)

起動時: RAINBOW→COMET→LARSON→CHASE→PULSE→STATIC→FILLIN→GLOW→STOROBE→SINEWAVE→RANDOM
→TRIWAVE→FADEINOUT→NANAIRO→MERAMERA→FIRE→BOUNCING→NONE(一旦停止)→RAINBOW…
で順番にスイッチします。ぜひお気に入りでビカビカさせてみてくださいｗ

～～～～～
このファームウェアは、M5Stack Core2 for AWS専用に作成されています。(M5Stack Core2＋M5GoBottom2モジュールの組み合わせでも動作可)
ベースはタカオさん制作のBTスピーカーなｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ stackchan-bluetooth-simple、その後robo8080さんが顔変更やレベルゲージ機能を追加したものにLED点灯のエフェクトを
追加したファームウェアを用意しました。まずはLED等を含めた動作確認等にご利用ください。(Port設定や初期値の音量等は状況に合わせYAMLファイルで調整下さい。)
操作方法等はGitHubリンク先のREADMEをご覧ください。現在、画面中央左部をタップすると7種のLEDエフェクトを操作することができます。
また内蔵LEDを点灯させるファームの他、Port.B、Port.Cを使った場合のファームも公開中です。(右側で選択ください)
author: t_mac116

name: ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝ(ランダムwav再生）
description:
【注意】Core2 Ver.1.1では動きません。
独り言を言うｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝです。セリフをSDカードにwavファイルで入れておくとランダムに再生します。
【使い方】
* サーボはPORT.Aに接続してください。

name: ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝRadikoプレイヤー
description:

You can listen to radiko with Stack-Chan.
Note: Can only be used in Japan.
M5Stack Core2 ｽﾀｯｸﾁｬﾝで動きます。
サーボはPORT.Aに接続してください。
Wi-Fiの設定はSmartConfigを使用、

ボタンA：選曲　ボタンA長押し：音量＋　ボタンB：音量ー
